thread.title: Giant prehistoric shark teeth washing up on North Carolina...
thread.title_full: Giant prehistoric shark teeth washing up on North Carolina... | www.ajc.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: Giant prehistoric shark teeth washing up on North Carolina...
text:
Beachcombers in North Carolina may be in for a big surprise, as giant teeth belonging to the ancient Megaladon have been washing ashore.
Experts estimate that with fossilized teeth washing ashore measuring approximately six inches long, he prehistoric shark-like creatures would have measured an estimated 60 feet long. Some of the teeth are as large as an adult’s hand.
>> Read more trending stories
The coastal North Carolina region has been a hotspot for Megalodon fossils, according to PIX11 , with this month setting a record in fossilized finds.
Beachgoers in North Carolina are finding teeth belonging to a 60-foot prehistoric shark. https://t.co/TgZygJJyPT pic.twitter.com/a0odEJ1twa
— PIX11 News (@PIX11News) October 24, 2015 Beachgoers in North Carolina are finding teeth belonging to a 60-foot prehistoric shark https://t.co/S1Qzlxkqcx pic.twitter.com/pvKKyT3u9L
— Austin Hunt (@AustinHunt) October 24, 2015
